ewu.embroidit.parkc.pattern

Class EmbPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • ewu.embroidit.parkc.pattern.EmbPattern

  • public class EmbPattern
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an embroidery pattern. A pattern contains a combination of lines and primitive shapes created by connecting stitch locations with colored threads inside of an embroidery hoop.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addShape(javafx.scene.shape.Shape shape)
      Adds a shape to the shape list.
      void addShapeWrapper(A_EmbShapeWrapper shapeWrapper)
      Adds the shape wrapper passed as a parameter to the hash using the shape contained within it as the key.
      void addStitchAbs(double x, double y, int flags, int isAutoColorIndex)
      Adds a stitch to the import stitch list at the absolute position (x, y).
      void addStitchRel(double dx, double dy, int flags, int isAutocolorIndex)
      Adds a stitch to the import stitch list relative to the previous stitch.
      void addThread(int index)
      Gets the color at the given color index, creates a new thread of this color, and adds it to the patterns thread list.
      void addThreadByValue(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Adds a thread to the threadList using a direct color value instead of referencing the available color list.
      int getColorIndex()
      Returns the current color index of this pattern
      javafx.geometry.Point2D getHomePoint()
      Returns the home stitch coordinates for this pattern.

      Returns the last x stitch position.
      double getLastY()
      Returns the last y stitch position.

      [NOT CURRENTLY IN USE] Returns the maximum color index found in this patterns stitch list.

      Gets the shape wrapper that corresponds to the given shape.

      Returns this patterns list of stitches

      Removes the passed shape, if it exists.

      Sets the patterns name to the given string.
